info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN WEBSTER...CADDO... NORTHERN CLAIBORNE AND BOSSIER PARISHES...MARION...SOUTHEASTERN CASS...HARRISON...NORTHERN PANOLA...NORTHEASTERN RUSK AND SOUTHEASTERN GREGG COUNTIES THROUGH 500 AM CST... At 359 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Welcome to near Smithland to 6 miles northeast of Harleton to Hallsville to 7 miles north of Henderson. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Marshall, Springhill, Vivian, Hallsville, Greenwood, Blanchard, Haynesville, Waskom, Jefferson, Benton, Tatum, Cullen, Plain Dealing, Cotton Valley, Oil City, Sarepta, Beckville, and Mooringsport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for northwestern Louisiana...and northeastern Texas.
